orProtocol.label: OGC Catalogue Service for the Web
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Catalog service for the web v2.0.2 endpoint (should use differnt protocol identifier if the endpoint is not v2.0.2; these are not yet defined here). The gmd:function value in the CI_Online resource should be 'information' if the provided URL is a getCapabilities request.

orProtocol.label: OGC Sensor Observation Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Sensor Observation service v?? endpoint (should use differnt protocol identifier if the endpoint is not that version; these are not yet defined here). The gmd:function value in the CI_Online resource should be 'information' if the provided URL is a getCapabilities request. Note that if the service offers multiple datasets in different offerings, the parameters necessary to access the correct offering should be specified in the gmd:CI_OnlineResource/gmd:description element; recommended practice is to use a JSON object with keys that are parameter names and values that are the necessary parameters.

orProtocol.label: OGC Sensor Planning Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an Sensor Planning Service

orProtocol.label: OGC Sensor Alert Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an Sensor Alert Service

orProtocol.label: OGC Web Notification Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an Web Notification Service

orProtocol.label: OGC Web Coverage Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Web coverage service v?? endpoint (should use differnt protocol identifier if the endpoint is not that version; these are not yet defined here). The gmd:function value in the CI_Online resource should be 'information' if the provided URL is a getCapabilities request. Note that if the service offers multiple datasets in different coverages, the parameters necessary to access the correct coverage should be specified in the gmd:CI_OnlineResource/gmd:description element; recommended practice is to use a JSON object with keys that are parameter names and values that are the necessary parameters.

orProtocol.label: OGC Web Feature Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Web Feature Service v?? endpoint (should use differnt protocol identifier if the endpoint is not that version; these are not yet defined here). The gmd:function value in the CI_Online resource should be 'information' if the provided URL is a getCapabilities request. Note that if the service offers multiple datasets in different feature types the typeName parameter necessary to access the correct data should be specified in the gmd:CI_OnlineResource/gmd:description element; recommended practice is to use a JSON object with keys that are parameter names and values that are the necessary parameters.

orProtocol.label: OGC Web Map Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Web Map Service v?? endpoint (should use differnt protocol identifier if the endpoint is not that version; these are not yet defined here). The gmd:function value in the CI_Online resource should be 'information' if the provided URL is a getCapabilities request. Note that if the service offers multiple datasets in different map layers, the layers parameters necessary to access the correct data should be specified in the gmd:CI_OnlineResource/gmd:description element; recommended practice is to use a JSON object with keys that are parameter names and values that are the necessary parameters.

orProtocol.label: OGC Web Map Service - Cached
orProtocol.comments: This is an unofficial profile of WMS using OSGeo recommendations to pull cached map tiles from the server when available. Often this is specified with a 'tiled=true' URL parameter in the GetMap request.
orProtocol.deprecated: While WMS-C has been superceded by the OSGeo Tile Map Service specification (TMS) and the OGC Web Map Tile Service standard (WMTS), it is still widely supported.

orProtocol.label: OGC Web Map Tile Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Web Map Tile Service

orProtocol.label: OGC Web Processing Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Web Processing Service v?? endpoint (should use differnt protocol identifier if the endpoint is not that version; these are not yet defined here). The gmd:function value in the CI_Online resource should be 'information' if the provided URL is a getCapabilities request. Other parameters necessary to access the correct processing service should be specified in the gmd:CI_OnlineResource/gmd:description element; recommended practice is to use a JSON object with keys that are parameter names and values that are the necessary parameters.

orProtocol.label: OGC OpenLS Directory Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC OpenLS Directory Service

orProtocol.label: OGC OpenLS Gateway Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC OpenLS Gateway Service

orProtocol.label: OGC OpenLS Utility Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC OpenLS Utility Service

orProtocol.label: OGC OpenLS Presentation Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC OpenLS Presentation Service

orProtocol.label: OGC OpenLS Route Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC OpenLS Route Service

orProtocol.label: OGC Coordinate Transformation Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Coordinate Transformation Service

orProtocol.label: Gazetteer Service Profile of the Web Feature Service Implementation Specification
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OGC Gazetteer Service Profile of the Web Feature Service Implementation Specification

orProtocol.label: OGC OWS Context
orProtocol.comments: Specifies a fully configured service set which can be exchanged

orProtocol.label: OGC Geopackage
orProtocol.comments: SQLite Extension for exchange or direct use of vector geospatial features and / or tile matrix sets of earth images and raster maps at various scales

orProtocol.label: OGC SensorThings API
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for a SensorThings API

orProtocol.label: ESRI ArcIMS Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an ArcIMS endpoint. ArcIMS requests are tunneled via HTTP Get URL's

orProtocol.label: ESRI ArcGIS Service
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an ESRI Map service endpoint. ESRI REST requests are tunneled via HTTP Get URL's

orProtocol.label: ArcGIS Map Package
orProtocol.comments: Example URI for ArcGIS Map Package. Mpk is a file format. A map package contains a map document (.mxd) and the data referenced by the layers it contains, packaged into one convenient, portable file.

orProtocol.label: OPeNDAP root URL
orProtocol.comments: Link is the root URL for an OpenDAP endpoint. An OPeNDAP server replies to queries for data and other services in the form of specially formed URLs that start with a root URL, and use a suffix on the root URL and a constraint expression to indicate which service is requested and what the parameters are. Example suffixes are dods, das, dds, nc. OpenDAP defines a syntax for constraint expressions as well.

orProtocol.label: OPeNDAP Hyrax server
orProtocol.comments: Link is the root URL for an This is the OPeNDAP 4 Data Server, also known as Hyrax. Hyrax is a data server that implements the DAP2 and DAP4 protocols, works with a number of different data formats and supports a wide variety of customization options from tailoring the look of the server's web pages to complex server-side processing operations.

orProtocol.label: NetCDF Subset Service
orProtocol.comments: Link is the root URL for a THREDDS datasets. The NetCDF Subset Service enables subsetting CDM scientific datasets using earth coordinates, such as lat/lon bounding boxes and date ranges; requests are made via HTTP GET with key-value pairs (KVP) for parameters encoded in HTTP URIs. The resources identified are THREDDS datasets. The resource URIs have a root host name and path, typically something like http://servername:8080/thredds/ncss/, followed by a path that identifies a particular dataset {path/dataset}. A subset of the dataset is considered a view of a resource, specified by query parameters following the character '?' after the dataset path: http://servername:8080/thredds/ncss/{path/dataset}?{subset}. An 'accept' parameter may be used to specify the desired resource representation.

orProtocol.label: Common Data Model Remote Web Service
orProtocol.comments: Example

orProtocol.label: Common Data Model index subsetting
orProtocol.comments: CDM Remote provides remote access to UNIDATA Common Data Model (CDM) datasets, using ncstream as the on-the-wire protocol. Client requests are of the form endpoint?query, and the specification defines a vocabulary of valid query parameters. There are two levels of service: 1) CdmRemote provides index subsetting on remote CDM datasets; 2) CdmrFeature provides coordinate subsetting on remote CDM Feature Datasets

orProtocol.label: Common Data Model coordinate subsetting
orProtocol.comments: Link is endpoint URL that provides coordinate subsetting on UNIDATA Common Data Model (CDM) datasets, using ncstream as the on-the-wire protocol. Client requests are of the form endpoint?query, and the specification defines a vocabulary of valid query parameters.

orProtocol.label: THREDDS Catalog
orProtocol.comments: Link is a THREDDS Catalog URL that provides the XML for traversing programatically. Can be used for datasets and collections of datasets.

orProtocol.label: OGC Geography Markup Language
orProtocol.comments: Example

orProtocol.label: Web Address (URL)
orProtocol.comments: Indicates that XLINK properties are encoded as key-value pairs in content of a dct:references element to provide a machine actionable link.

orProtocol.label: Web Service Description Language XML document describing service operation
SPARQL protocol for HTTP
orProtocol.comments: SPARQL Protocol specifies a means for conveying SPARQL queries and updates to a SPARQL processing service and returning the results via HTTP to the entity that requested them

orProtocol.label: OpenSearch template
orProtocol.comments: use to indicate link is a template conforming to the OpenSearch specification

orProtocol.label: OpenSearch description document
orProtocol.comments: indicates a link to get an openSearch description document

orProtocol.label: link provides information about resource
orProtocol.comments: function of link it to http:GET information about resource

orProtocol.label: link provides template to access resource
orProtocol.comments: Link text is a URI template; applicationProfile attribute value associated with the link should indicate the specification for the template scheme (e.g. OpenSearch1.1).

orProtocol.label: link will get resource
orProtocol.comments: function of link it to http:GET a representation of the resource; the link type attribute value(s) should indicate the MIME types of available representations

orProtocol.label: link is service endpoint
orProtocol.comments: Link value is the URL of a service endpoint; the link protocol and applicationProfile (and possibly other link properties like overlayAPI, depending on the link attributes profile in use) attribute values should identify the service protocol specification

orProtocol.label: link provides form to obtain resource
orProtocol.comments: link value is URL of web application requiring user interaction to order/request access to the resource

orProtocol.label: link provides form for searching resource
orProtocol.comments: link value is URL of web application requiring user interaction to search/browse/subset the resource.

orProtocol.label: tile mill map service description
orProtocol.comments: link is description of a TileMill map service endpoint. Link type would be application/json; function would be information.

orProtocol.label: IRIS Seismic event service
orProtocol.comments: Link returns event (earthquake) information from the catalogs submitted to the IRIS DMC

orProtocol.label: Earthquake markup language
orProtocol.comments: XML markup language for earthquake hypocenter data

orProtocol.label: a file
orProtocol.comments: CKAN metadata vocabulary for populating the type attribute on a CKAN resource; indicates that an http GET of this url should yield a bitstream

orProtocol.label: ISO 19115 metadata in ISO19139 encoding
orProtocol.comments: This is the CharacterString value used by Geonetwork OpenSource to identify ISO metadata record instances; apparently have to assume that its using the 2006 corrigendum with no specific profile conventions.

orProtocol.label: USGIN-profile ISO 19115 metadata
orProtocol.comments: This is the CharacterString Value mandated by the USGIN profile of ISO19115/19139 for instance documents to self-identify.

orProtocol.label: Hypertext transfer Protocol, v1.1
orProtocol.comments: Use to indicate gmd:CI_OnlineResource URLs that are simple http links to a target resource representation for download; redundant as the URL prefix 'http:' conveys the same information.

orProtocol.label: HTTP over TLS
orProtocol.comments: Use to indicate gmd:CI_OnlineResource URLs that are simple https links to a target resource representation for download; redundant as the URL prefix 'https:' conveys the same information.

orProtocol.label: FILE TRANSFER PROTOCOL (FTP)
orProtocol.comments: Use to indicate gmd:CI_OnlineResource URLs that are simple ftp links to a target resource representation for download; redundant as the URL prefix 'ftp:' conveys the same information.

orProtocol.label: GeoJSON
orProtocol.comments: GeoJSON is a geospatial data interchange format based on JavaScript Object Notation (JSON)

orProtocol.label: GIT
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for a GIT repository

orProtocol.label: OKFN Data Package
orProtocol.comments: A Data Package is a simple way of packaging up data

orProtocol.label: Boundless GeoGig
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for a GeoGig REST API

orProtocol.label: OData v4.0
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an OData JSON endpoint

orProtocol.label: dat REST API
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for a dat REST API

orProtocol.label: GeoServer REST configuration API
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for a Geoserver rest API to configure featuretypes in Geoserver (and mapserver) remotely

orProtocol.label: Google Protocol Buffers
orProtocol.comments: Googles mechanism for serializing structured data

orProtocol.label: Google Fusion Tables
orProtocol.comments: Google mechanism for interating with online data tables

orProtocol.label: Live Access Server
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is a LAS endpoint

orProtocol.label: Open Street Map API
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for a OSM APIfor fetching and saving raw geodata from/to an OpenStreetMap database

orProtocol.label: ERDDAP Data Service for Gridded Datasets
orProtocol.comments: griddap lets you request a data subset, graph, or map from a gridded dataset (for example, sea surface temperature data from a satellite), via a specially formed URL. griddap uses the OPeNDAP (external link) Data Access Protocol (DAP) (external link) and its projection constraints (external link). Link is the root URL for an ERDDAP griddap service endpoint. The service responds to OPeNDAP requests and related ERDDAP-specific requests to a gridded dataset. A request starts with this root URL, adds a file type extension, and sometimes a constraint expression to specify a subset of data. Example file type extensions which don't require a constraint are .das, .dds, .html, and .graph. Example file type extensions which do require a constraint are .dods, .nc, .mat, .json, and .htmlTable. Full documentation for ERDDAP API at http://coastwatch.pfeg.noaa.gov/erddap/rest.html

orProtocol.label: ERDDAP Data Service for Tabular Datasets
orProtocol.comments: Tabledap lets you request a data subset, a graph, or a map from a tabular dataset (for example, buoy data), via a specially formed URL. tabledap uses the OPeNDAP (external link) Data Access Protocol (DAP) (external link) and its selection constraints (external link). Link is the root URL for an ERDDAP tabledap service endpoint. The service responds to OPeNDAP requests and related ERDDAP-specific requests to a tabular (sequence) dataset. A request starts with this root URL, adds a file type extension, and sometimes a constraint expression to specify a subset of data. Example file type extensions which don't require a constraint are .das, .dds, .html, and .graph. Example file type extensions which do require a constraint are .dods, .nc, .mat, .json, and .htmlTable. Full documentation for ERDDAP API at http://coastwatch.pfeg.noaa.gov/erddap/rest.html

orProtocol.label: Advanced Message Queuing Protocol
orProtocol.comments: gmd:protocol value that indicates CI_OnlineResource URL is for an AMQP broker
